slide-1.heading: Visually impaired or Senior
slide-1.text: User whose visual acuity at five meters is less than 4/10th. Uses character magnification or text-to-speech tools.

slide-2.heading: Blind
slide-2.text: User with a total visual impairment. He uses screen readers combined with a Braille display

slide-3.heading: Digital accessibility is a right
slide-3.text: With a full array of features, PubliSpeakâ„¢ addresses branding, visibility and audience acquisition issues.

slide-4.heading: A legal obligation
slide-4.text: This multi-year plan, with a maximum duration of 3 years, defines all the actions in favor of digital accessibility implemented annually.

slide-5.heading: Improve your referencing
slide-5.text: Accessibility facilitates access to content for all users, including search engines.

block-1.heading: Access the senior market
block-1.text: An accessible interface is generally more ergonomic and easier to use than its non-accessible competitors.
block-1.btn-alt: Learn more about Access the senior market

block-2.heading: Enhance your image as a citizen
block-2.text: Investing in digital accessibility also means enhancing your employer brand to attract the best talent.
block-2.btn-alt: Learn more about Enhance your corporate image

block-3.heading: Improve your natural referencing
block-3.text: Accessibility facilitates access to content for all users, including search engines. Many accessibility criteria are linked to SEO
block-3.btn-alt: Learn more about Improve your natural referencing

block-4.heading: Reduce maintenance costs
block-4.text: One of the rules of accessibility is the strict separation of content and presentation
block-4.btn-alt: Learn more about Reduce Maintenance Costs
